filmography.title: 12 Angry Men
filmography.role_description: A slick, impatient salesman who is more interested in making a baseball game than in the gravity of the trial, initially voting guilty to finish quickly.
filmography.plot: A jury holdout attempts to prevent a miscarriage of justice by forcing his colleagues to reconsider the evidence.

filmography.title: Heaven Can Wait
filmography.role_description: The bewildered and fiercely loyal trainer of a quarterback who has been reincarnated into the body of a millionaire.
filmography.plot: A Los Angeles Rams quarterback, accidentally taken away by an overanxious angel before he was meant to die, returns to life in the body of a recently murdered millionaire.

filmography.title: Shampoo
filmography.role_description: A wealthy and somewhat oblivious businessman whose wife, mistress, and daughter are all involved with the same hairdresser.
filmography.plot: A hairdresser carrying on affairs with several women tries to get a bank loan to open his own shop on the eve of the 1968 presidential election.

filmography.title: All the President's Men
filmography.role_description: The tough but supportive metropolitan editor of The Washington Post who oversees Woodward and Bernstein's investigation.
filmography.plot: Two Washington Post reporters uncover the truth behind the Watergate scandal.

filmography.title: Being There
filmography.role_description: The President of the United States who, impotent in the face of national malaise, turns to a simple gardener for wisdom.
filmography.plot: A simple-minded gardener named Chance becomes an unlikely advisor to a powerful businessman and an insider in Washington politics.

filmography.title: The Verdict
filmography.role_description: The mentor and friend of a down-on-his-luck alcoholic lawyer, helping him with a medical malpractice case that could redeem him.
filmography.plot: A lawyer sees the chance to salvage his career and self-respect by taking a medical malpractice case to trial rather than settling.

filmography.title: Used Cars
filmography.role_description: A dual role playing two brothers: the kindly owner of a struggling used car lot and his ruthless, wealthy rival across the street.
filmography.plot: A used car salesman tries to save his late boss's lot from being taken over by the boss's evil brother.

filmography.title: Brian's Song
filmography.role_description: The legendary head coach of the Chicago Bears who navigates the friendship and tragedy of two of his players.
filmography.plot: Based on the real-life relationship between teammates Brian Piccolo and Gale Sayers and the bond established when Piccolo discovers he is dying.
filmography.awards: Primetime Emmy: Win – Outstanding Single Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role

filmography.title: ...And Justice for All
filmography.role_description: A suicidal, eccentric judge who takes the protagonist on a terrifying helicopter ride and carries a gun under his robes.
filmography.plot: An ethical lawyer is forced to defend a guilty judge, while defending other innocent clients and trying to find justice in a corrupt legal system.

filmography.title: While You Were Sleeping
filmography.role_description: The kind-hearted godfather of the man in a coma who learns the protagonist's secret but keeps it to himself.
filmography.plot: A lonely transit worker saves the life of a commuter she has been crushing on, but a mix-up leads his family to believe she is his fiancée.

filmography.title: Bullets Over Broadway
filmography.role_description: A theatrical producer who secures funding for a play from a mobster in exchange for casting the mobster's girlfriend.
filmography.plot: A struggling playwright is forced to cast a mobster's talentless girlfriend in his latest drama in order to get it produced.

filmography.title: Mighty Aphrodite
filmography.role_description: A blind Greek prophet who serves as a narrator and commentator on the modern-day events of the film.
filmography.plot: When a man meets his adopted son's biological mother, a prostitute, he decides to help her improve her life.

filmography.title: The Apprenticeship of Duddy Kravitz
filmography.role_description: The father of the ambitious title character, a taxi driver who unintentionally fuels his son's ruthless drive for success.
filmography.plot: A young Jewish man in Montreal is determined to make a name for himself and buy land, alienating his friends and family in the process.

filmography.title: Run Silent, Run Deep
filmography.role_description: A loyal crew member on a submarine commanded by a captain obsessed with sinking a specific Japanese destroyer.
filmography.plot: A U.S. submarine commander, obsessed with sinking a certain Japanese ship, pushes his crew to the brink.

filmography.title: Death on the Nile
filmography.role_description: A Swiss doctor on a Nile cruise who becomes a suspect when an heiress is murdered.
filmography.plot: As Hercule Poirot enjoys a luxurious cruise down the Nile, a newlywed heiress is found murdered on board.

filmography.title: Donovan's Reef
filmography.role_description: A doctor living on a South Pacific island who has a secret family, visited by his estranged daughter.
filmography.plot: Three World War II veterans living on a French Polynesian island have their paradise disrupted when a daughter arrives.

filmography.title: From Here to Eternity
filmography.role_description: A soldier in the barracks who interacts with Prewitt and Maggio in this classic WWII drama.
filmography.plot: In Hawaii in 1941, a private is cruelly punished for not boxing in his unit's team, while his captain's wife and second-in-command are having an affair.

filmography.title: The Replacements
filmography.role_description: The owner of the Washington Sentinels who hires a replacement team during a player strike. Warden's final film role.
filmography.plot: During a pro football strike, the owners hire substitute players to finish the season.

filmography.title: Problem Child
filmography.role_description: The wealthy, callous father running for mayor who constantly belittles his son.
filmography.plot: A couple adopts a seven-year-old boy who turns out to be a mischievous troublemaker.

filmography.title: Things to Do in Denver When You're Dead
filmography.role_description: The narrator and a former criminal who recounts the story of Jimmy the Saint.
filmography.plot: Five different criminals face imminent death after a botched job.

filmography.title: Bulworth
filmography.role_description: A seasoned political operative and advisor to a senator who has a nervous breakdown.
filmography.plot: A suicidal senator arranges his own assassination but then has a change of heart and decides to speak the unvarnished truth.

filmography.title: Dirty Work
filmography.role_description: The father of one of the main characters who needs a heart transplant, sparking the revenge-for-hire plot.
filmography.plot: A loser starts a revenge-for-hire business to raise money for his friend's father's heart surgery.

filmography.title: The White Buffalo
filmography.role_description: A one-eyed frontiersman and old friend who aids Wild Bill Hickok in his hunt for a legendary beast.
filmography.plot: Wild Bill Hickok and Crazy Horse team up to hunt a white buffalo in the Black Hills.

filmography.title: The Man Who Loved Cat Dancing
filmography.role_description: A member of an outlaw gang involved in a train robbery and a kidnapping.
filmography.plot: A woman leaves her abusive husband and gets mixed up with a gang of outlaws who have robbed a train.

filmography.title: Bye Bye Braverman
filmography.role_description: One of four Jewish intellectuals who travel through New York City to attend the funeral of a friend.
filmography.plot: Four friends try to find the funeral of a writer they all knew, leading to a series of comic misadventures.
